meanings.definition: To bark louder or more frequently than another dog.
meanings.sent1: The small dog tried to outbark the big dog in the park.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's dog tends to outbark all the other dogs in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as each dog tried to outbark the others for the title of 'Loudest Pup'.
meanings.sent4: The enthusiastic puppy managed to outbark even the most vocal of the older dogs.
meanings.sent5: The echo of the dog's outbark reverberated through the quiet night.

meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy always manages to outbark his siblings during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The champion barker was able to outbark all the other dogs at the competition.
meanings.sent3: It was a surprise to see the little dog outbark the big, intimidating ones at the park.
meanings.sent4: The determined dog would not stop until he could outbark every other dog in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The loud outbark of the dog startled the birds nearby, causing them to fly away in a hurry.

meanings.definition: To bark louder or more frequently than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The excited dog would always outbark whenever the doorbell rang.
meanings.sent2: The guard dog would outbark any intruders who dared to approach the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to enjoy trying to outbark the dogs from the safety of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The determined dog managed to outbark the noisy construction site next door.
meanings.sent5: The outbark of the dog was so loud that it could be heard from across the street.
